headerText: The bottom sheet is a modified `v-dialog` that slides from the bottom of the screen, similar to a `v-bottom-navigation`. Whereas a bottom navigation component is for buttons and specific application level actions, a bottom sheet can contain anything.

usage.desc: Here we display an example list of actions that could be present in an application.

inset.desc: Bottom sheets can be inset, reducing their maximum width on desktop to 70%. This can be further reduced manually using the `width` prop.

persistent.desc: Persistent bottom sheets can't be closed by clicking outside them.

model.desc: Bottom sheets can be controlled using `v-model`. You can use it to close them or if you can't use `activator` slot.

open-in-list.desc: By combining a functional list into a bottom sheet, you can create a simple 'open in' component.

player.desc: Using a inset bottom sheet, you can make practical components such as this simple music player.

props.disabled: Disables the ability to open the bottom sheet
props.hideOverlay: Hide the display of the overlay
props.inset: Reduces the sheet content maximum width to 70%
props.internalActivator: Designates whether to use an internal activator
props.maxWidth: Specify the maximum width of the sheet's container
props.openOnHover: Designates whether bottom sheet should open on activator hover
props.returnValue: Returns value to original state if the save function is not called
